data.title: Windows 7 build errors - git:// translating to https:// incorrectly
data.body:
This can be immediately closed, I just wanted to stick it up in case someone else ran into the same problem.

I was having the build fail because repo's couldn't be cloned; on inspection, `git://github.com/foo` was being turned into `https://github.com//foo`, with the doubled second `//`.

Solution is to run `git config --global --edit` and change:

```
[url "https://github.com/"]
    insteadOf = git://github.com
```

so that they both have a trailing `/`.  (It may work to just remove both too).

data.title: Autoscroll to selections in model layer when added
data.body: Fixes #2698

data.title: Cursor line highlights don't go full width and show with selections
data.body:
![screenshot 2014-06-20 15 14 32](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1789/3346541/b93a3ae0-f8c7-11e3-83d7-ddc4e949ec72.png)
- Seems like we need to always render lines at the full width of their container.
- We need a special property for decorations that only renders them when their marker is empty, so the cursor line only highlights without a selection.

data.title: Preload grammars on deserialization
data.body:
While digging into #2679, I noticed that all files are loaded with the null grammar until the specific grammar is loaded. This creates the issue in #2679, but also makes the editor feel dumpy on load as there is a sizable chunk of time where files are not colorized. 

So this preloads / sync loads the grammars needed by deserialized buffers. 

I just serialize the grammar name, and on deserialize, the `TokenizedBuffer` calls `atom.syntax.requestGrammarPreload`, which emits an event, which the relevant package handles and loads its grammars sync. This whole process happens _right_ before the soon-to-be-new TokenizedBuffer chooses its grammar. 

The biggest issue is that nowhere do we map grammar names to the name of the package, so I have a shitty hardcoded line in there to do this work until I have a legit solution. Options for solving this issue:
1. on serialize, serialize the name of the package, rather than the grammar name
2. add a package.json field specifying the grammar names that the package provides. Since grammars are not activated right away, I have no other way to read the name of the grammar. 

I'm leaning toward 1 because it will be hard to get people to change their package.json's and people will forget to add this field anyway.

What do you guys think about all this?

Will fix #2679 if we decide to go down this route.

data.title: Render highlights on their own layer to avoid GPU artifacts
data.body:
Previously, when the last highlight div was removed from the lines layer, chunks of the lines would sometimes disappear. Since we've discovered that giving the lines an opaque background doesn't help with subpixel anti-aliasing anyway, I've found that rendering highlights on their own layer behind the lines and making the lines layer transparent avoids the artifacts.

Unfortunately, _now_ removing the last highlights causes rendering artifacts on the wrap guide, which is also mounted on the highlights layer. So this PR also breaks out a separate layer for the underlayer.

data.title: Adding a cursor/selection does not scroll
data.body:
Noticed this initially while using `cmd-d` and the next selected occurrence wasn't scrolled to.

In this gif I am using `ctrl-shift-down` to add a new cursor, it does not scroll.

![scrolling](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/671378/3346122/ca4b138c-f8c1-11e3-8a8f-30fe17f7c200.gif)

data.title: Selection it not the entire width of the window
data.body:
1. Open the tree view
2. Open an editor
3. Select all in the editor
4. Toggle the tree view close

Selection does not extend the width of the editor area.

![screen shot 2014-06-20 at 2 07 29 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/671378/3345921/0ede0d0e-f8bf-11e3-9419-ac6c2bfec5aa.png)

data.title: Clicking and dragging up in gutter does not scroll
data.body:
Clicking on the gutter and dragging up does not expand the selection and scroll the editor when you reach the top of the gutter.

This didn't work in the old editor but I noticed in the new editor it doesn't work either.

It does scroll down though correctly when clicking and dragging.

data.title: Snippets that overwrite existing ones
data.body:
The Language Rspec package comes with it's set of snippets, and those are fine, _except_ that they use double quoted strings (I know, I know, roll your eyes so we can get past that part :-). Anyway, I set up my own snippets in my snippets.cson file (the one accessed via Atom > Open Your Snippets) that overwrite some of the existing Rspec ones.

When I first open up Atom and try to use one of my custom snippets they don't seem to be loaded and the Language Rspec ones are used instead. If I then open up my snippets.cson file and hit cmd+s Atom picks them up and starts using my snippets.

data.title: Fix caching of gutter's previous decorations
Select page up/down
data.body: Continuation of #2361

data.title: Failed to activate package on Windows: Bootstrap's JavaScript requires jQuery
data.body:
I think internally Atom uses a trimmed down version because it seems to be missing some JS components like [Collapse](http://getbootstrap.com/javascript/#collapse) which I need for my package. To fix that problem I included the full bootsrap.min.js with my project and require the file like this: 
`require './ext/bootstrap.min.js'`
This works just fine on OS X and I'm able to use all the Bootsrap components. However I just tried to load the package on Windows and I'm getting this error:
`Failed to activate package named 'Ask-Stack-Atom' Error: Bootstrap's JavaScript requires jQuery`

Now I know Atom (and space-pen) heavily use jQuery so I'm pretty sure it should be installed somewhere. Since the installation and build process is different on Windows I'm wondering if this is excepted behavior or a bug.

data.title: Syntax highligher issue (nested quotes?)
data.body:
I'm doing some customization work on an OpenCart site and I noticed that the syntax highlighting in `admin/model/catalog/product.php` is all messed up.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5471922/3343789/f36ac0a0-f8a3-11e3-8a82-0df981984c8d.png)

Somewhere around the `subtract` field, Atom's highlighter gets stuck in "string" mode. This continues to line 137, where the code turns a uniform gray, and then it returns to normal on line 139.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5471922/3343849/9610bbb6-f8a4-11e3-8f1c-19f82765a7dc.png)

Komodo Edit parses the same file correctly:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5471922/3344001/17e676a2-f8a6-11e3-95e9-4c771656afe0.png)

Atom 0.105.0, OS X 10.9.3.

data.title: Undo/ReDo behavior completely broken
data.body:
## Version 0.105.00

When initiating an undo oftentimes Atom will undo an excessive amount of changes, other times it does it character by character. 

I've had undo revert a file to it's original condition or previous saved state after an hour of work by a single undo. What is worse, redo no longer works at all. 

I am using Vim mode so this may be related, I believe it might be undo everything done during the current insert.

data.title: How to build atom on Windows to some folder other than `Program Files\Atom`
data.body:
This is a question rather than an issue. Is there a command line argument to [script/build](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/script/build) that will alter where the application will be built? My TeamCity build of atom would rather not use that folder for its created artifacts.

https://github.com/atom/atom/commit/5316d586d12518e1ce8707f3715c6e64acdff102#diff-6782128dd8a732141c0cf034165dd915

data.title: Added a hint about the required Python path.
data.body: In order to alert users that the Atom build scripts expect to find Python in the default installation folder.

data.title: on packages' "activated" event getActivePackages() returns an empty list
data.body:
This is pretty easy to test.  Create a package, remove the activation trigger from packages.json and fill activate method:

``` coffee
    activate: ->
        atom.packages.once "activated", =>
             console.log "activated", atom.packages.getActivePackages()
```

I expected this to print a list of all active packages.

I found out, that "activated" event is triggered right after all activations are promised.  At that time, the dictionary of
activated packages is still empty, they all drop in one by one, as soon the activate method returned.

Is this by design?  Then there should be another event, as soon all packages' activation methods returned. Maybe packages "ready" event?

data.title: Current path status indicator suggestion
Resize Tree Sometimes Continues After Mouse Up.
data.body:
Sometimes when resizing the sidebar tree, it continues to resize even after you let go of the mouse button.

I've found one way to reproduce, but there is other random events causing the same effect:
1. Open Developer Tools.
2. Start to drag the tree resize border. Press and hold the mouse button.
3. Move the cursor over the developer tools window.
4. Let go of the mouse button.
5. Move mouse back into the view and notice the window is still resized to the position of the mouse.

data.title: Render line decorations
data.body:
This adds support for `type: 'line'` decorations. Decorations of `type: 'line'` will add a class to the relevant screen lines.

Closes #2569

data.title: Batch all editor updates together automatically via process.nextTick
data.body:
Fixes #2642 #2635 

Previously, I was trying to explicitly batch editor updates together with the `batchUpdates` method, but it was going to be impossible to catch everything. The bugs referenced were caused by cases where we were forgetting to batch, which caused massive redundant work to be performed. This PR updates the update mechanism to always wait until the end of the current synchronous code block with `process.nextTick`. It seems to be more responsive than `setImmediate`, so this also supplants the mechanism that delayed updates for decorations.

data.title: individual descriptions for instructions
data.body: The proposed style allows properly formatted descriptions and leaves more vertical space to the commands.

data.title: Reloading unfolds everything
data.body:
For a bit, it is all folded like it should be. Then the syntax highlighting is applied, and there are no more folds:

![unfold-issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/69169/3334542/504f5626-f801-11e3-85a4-6efb438676bd.gif)

data.title: Context menus aren't removed when a package is removed.
data.body: Based on information from https://github.com/atom/tree-view/issues/131 and https://github.com/atom/tabs/issues/29

data.title: Rename the editor.projectHome config option
data.body:
We should rename this config option to something that describes it better. It is not easy to figure the intent via the name. Also, Atom has a class named `project` which adds to the confusion.

This option is currently describes:
1. Where projects and themes are created by Package Generator
2. Where projects are assumed to be stored by Atom. So if there was an "Open Project" command and I gave it "foo" it would look for a "foo" directory in this path.

@lee-dohm also suggested that `core` would be a more appropriate namespace than `editor.

/via https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/1648

data.title: Don’t render decorations on the last empty line when selection not empty
data.body:
Works like the old editor.

Fixes #2657

Ship a couple DLLs needed to run the app without installing Visual Studio first.
